definitions.text: (often followed by `from') not alike; different in nature or quality
examples: the word `nationalism' is used in at least two distinct senses
a tree related to but quite distinct from the European beech
management had interests quite distinct from those of their employees

definitions.text: easy to perceive; especially clearly outlined
examples: the ship appeared as a distinct silhouette

definitions.text: constituting a separate entity or part
examples: a government with three discrete divisions

definitions.text: clearly or sharply defined to the mind
examples: Claudius was the first to invade Britain with distinct...intentions of conquest
trenchant distinctions between right and wrong
